definition: to flow/to disseminate/to circulate or spread/to move or drift/to degenerate/to banish or send into exile/stream of water or sth resembling one/class, rate or grade

sentences.english: The disagreement among the family members healed over with time.
sentences.chinese: 家庭成員之間的不和隨着時間的流逝而消失。

sentences.english: By the time afternoon rolls around, you’re in caffeine withdrawal.
sentences.chinese: 下午時光流逝，你沉浸在咖啡因裏面。

sentences.english: The time is so unfeeling to pass.
sentences.chinese: 時光的流逝又是如此的無情。

sentences.english: Time cured him of his grief.
sentences.chinese: 時光的流逝治癒了他的悲哀。

sentences.english: You know, as times gose by, they say, He's washed up.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間流逝，有人會說，他氣數盡了。

sentences.english: Time passes, we have grown up to your Liangbin already Banbai.
sentences.chinese: 歲月流逝，我們都已長大可您的兩鬢卻已斑白。

sentences.english: However, when time is gone, it will never retun.
sentences.chinese: 然而，時間流逝了就永遠不回來了。

sentences.english: With time elapsing, my memory is not clear.
sentences.chinese: 隨着時間的流逝，我的記憶變得不清晰。

sentences.english: As time moved on, he looked much older than before.
sentences.chinese: 隨着歲月的流逝，他顯得蒼老多了。

sentences.english: My heart has grown rich with the passing of years.
sentences.chinese: 隨着歲月流逝，我的心變得豐富。

sentences.english: In fact, time allways goes by quickly . It can't be called back again.
sentences.chinese: 實際上，時間總是匆匆流逝，不可復得。

sentences.english: But all of that’s okay. I’ve adjusted my own beliefs about my self and my strengths as I go along.
sentences.chinese: 可是，歲月流逝，我調整了對自我以及能力的看法。
生命的流逝像奔流的江河。

sentences.english: Nothingis more familiar than the passage of time.
sentences.chinese: 沒有什麼比時間流逝更稀鬆平常的了。

sentences.english: The sands of time are running out for the central star of this the Hourglass Nebula.
sentences.chinese: 對沙漏星雲中的中央恆星來說，時間的沙粒正在流逝。

definition: (of time) to pass quickly/to be fleeting
(of time) to elapse or pass/(of a situation) to develop or evolve
to pass in an instant/over in the twinkling of an eye
to wear down/to sap/to whittle away/to while away/to idle away
a white steed flits past a crack (idiom); How time flies!
to fade into the distance/(fig.) to peter out/to fade away
